TITLE: Configuring ImprovMX Provider
DESCRIPTION: This code configures the Terraform provider for ImprovMX, specifying the source and requiring the user to set the `IMPROVMX_API_TOKEN` environment variable for authentication. The `source` attribute identifies the provider on the Terraform Registry.
SOURCE: https://github.com/issyl0/terraform-provider-improvmx/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: hcl
CODE:
```
terraform {
  required_providers {
    improvmx = {
      source = "issyl0/improvmx"
    }
  }
}

provider "improvmx" {
  // Set the `IMPROVMX_API_TOKEN` environment variable.
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: ImprovMX Provider Configuration in Terraform
DESCRIPTION: This HCL code block demonstrates how to configure the ImprovMX Terraform provider. It specifies the provider source and includes a placeholder for the ImprovMX API token. The API token can also be set using the `IMPROVMX_API_TOKEN` environment variable.
SOURCE: https://github.com/issyl0/terraform-provider-improvmx/blob/main/docs/index.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: HCL
CODE:
```
terraform {
  required_providers {
    improvmx = {
      source  = "issyl0/improvmx"
    }
  }
}

provider "improvmx" {
  token = "YOUR API TOKEN HERE"
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating ImprovMX Domain
DESCRIPTION: This code creates an ImprovMX domain using the `improvmx_domain` resource. It sets the `domain` attribute to "example.com", which represents the domain for which email forwarding will be configured. This resource creates a wildcard forward for the domain by default.
SOURCE: https://github.com/issyl0/terraform-provider-improvmx/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: hcl
CODE:
```
resource "improvmx_domain" "example" {
  domain = "example.com"
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating an ImprovMX Domain
DESCRIPTION: This Terraform configuration creates an ImprovMX domain. It requires the `domain` argument, which specifies the domain name to be managed by ImprovMX. The configuration also demonstrates the default wildcard email forward created by ImprovMX.
SOURCE: https://github.com/issyl0/terraform-provider-improvmx/blob/main/docs/resources/improvmx_domain.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: hcl
CODE:
```
// ImprovMX creates a wildcard email forward on each domain by default.
resource "improvmx_domain" "example" {
  domain = "example.com"
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating ImprovMX Email Forward
DESCRIPTION: This code creates an ImprovMX email forward using the `improvmx_email_forward` resource. It configures a forward for `hello@example.com` to `me@realdomain.com`, and specifies a dependency on the `improvmx_domain.example` resource to ensure the domain is created first.
SOURCE: https://github.com/issyl0/terraform-provider-improvmx/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: hcl
CODE:
```
resource "improvmx_email_forward" "hello" {
  domain            = "example.com"
  alias_name        = "hello"
  destination_email = "me@realdomain.com"
  depends_on = [improvmx_domain.example]
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating a Single Recipient Email Forward with ImprovMX
DESCRIPTION: This Terraform configuration creates an email forward using the `improvmx_email_forward` resource. It sets up a forward for 'reception@example.com' to 'joe@realdomain.com'. The `domain`, `alias_name`, and `destination_email` arguments are required to define the forward.
SOURCE: https://github.com/issyl0/terraform-provider-improvmx/blob/main/docs/resources/improvmx_email_forward.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: hcl
CODE:
```
resource "improvmx_email_forward" "example" {
  domain            = "example.com"
  alias_name        = "reception"
  destination_email = "joe@realdomain.com"
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating ImprovMX Wildcard Email Forward
DESCRIPTION: This code creates an ImprovMX wildcard email forward using the `improvmx_email_forward` resource. It configures a wildcard forward for all emails sent to `@example.com` to `joe@realdomain.com`, and specifies a dependency on the `improvmx_domain.example` resource to ensure the domain is created first.
SOURCE: https://github.com/issyl0/terraform-provider-improvmx/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: hcl
CODE:
```
resource "improvmx_email_forward" "wildcard" {
  domain            = "example.com"
  alias_name        = "*"
  destination_email = "joe@realdomain.com"
  depends_on = [improvmx_domain.example]
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating Multiple Recipient Email Forward with ImprovMX
DESCRIPTION: This Terraform configuration demonstrates creating an email forward to multiple recipients. It forwards emails sent to 'sales@example.com' to both 'alice@realdomain.com' and 'bob@realdomain.com'. Multiple email addresses are comma-separated in the `destination_email` argument.
SOURCE: https://github.com/issyl0/terraform-provider-improvmx/blob/main/docs/resources/improvmx_email_forward.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: hcl
CODE:
```
resource "improvmx_email_forward" "sales" {
  domain            = "example.com"
  alias_name        = "sales"
  destination_email = "alice@realdomain.com,bob@realdomain.com"
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating SMTP Credential with ImprovMX Terraform Resource (HCL)
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to define an `improvmx_smtp_credential` resource in Terraform. It sets the domain, username, and password for the SMTP credential. The password is read from a Terraform variable, which helps avoid hardcoding sensitive information directly into the configuration. The resource will create an SMTP credential on the specified ImprovMX domain.
SOURCE: https://github.com/issyl0/terraform-provider-improvmx/blob/main/docs/resources/improvmx_smtp_credential.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: hcl
CODE:
```
resource "improvmx_smtp_credential" "example" {
  domain   = "example.com"
  username = "example"
  password = var.password
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Importing an ImprovMX Email Forward
DESCRIPTION: This command shows how to import an existing ImprovMX email forward into Terraform. The `terraform import` command uses the resource name and a unique identifier (domain_alias) to associate the existing forward with the Terraform resource.
SOURCE: https://github.com/issyl0/terraform-provider-improvmx/blob/main/docs/resources/improvmx_email_forward.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
$ terraform import improvmx_email_forward.example example.com_hello
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Importing an Existing ImprovMX Domain
DESCRIPTION: This shell command demonstrates how to import an existing ImprovMX domain into Terraform. The `terraform import` command is used along with the resource name and the domain name to import the domain's state.
SOURCE: https://github.com/issyl0/terraform-provider-improvmx/blob/main/docs/resources/improvmx_domain.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
$ terraform import improvmx_domain.example example.com
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Querying Domain Check Status with Terraform
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to use the `improvmx_domain_check` data source to retrieve the status of a domain. It requires the `domain` argument to be set. The data source returns various attributes indicating the validity of MX and SPF records.
SOURCE: https://github.com/issyl0/terraform-provider-improvmx/blob/main/docs/data-sources/improvmx_domain_check.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: hcl
CODE:
```
data "improvmx_domain_check" "example_com" {
  domain = "example.com"
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configure Terraform Dev Provider (HCL)
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet configures Terraform to use a development version of the ImprovMX provider. It overrides the official provider with a local binary, enabling testing of local changes before release. Replace `/full/path/to/terraform-provider-improvmx/directory` with the actual path to the provider binary.
SOURCE: https://github.com/issyl0/terraform-provider-improvmx/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: hcl
CODE:
```
provider_installation {
  dev_overrides {
    "issyl0/improvmx" = "/full/path/to/terraform-provider-improvmx/directory"
  }

  direct {}
}
```
